exercises.task: Powiedz kiedy używamy czasu Present Simple, przedstaw jego konstrukcję oraz charakterystyczne zwroty.
Ułóż przykładowe zdania w czasie Present Simple wykorzystując następujące zwroty: every week, always, often, sometimes, never, at night, on Mondays, from time to time.
Odpowiedz na poniższe pytania:
content: What do you do in your free time?
What do you usually do at the weekends?
How often do you study English?
How often do you see your best friend?
Do you have any bad habits? Tell me about them.
What time do you usually wake up?

exercises.task: Opowiedz mi jak wygląda twój typowy dzień.
Opowiedz mi jak wygląda typowy dzień twoich rodziców / brata / znajomego / twojej ulubionej postaci z filmu.
Zadawanie pytań do tekstu (min. 2 pytania do każdego zdania).
Powiedz kiedy używamy czasu Present Continuous, przedstaw jego konstrukcję oraz charakterystyczne zwroty.
Ułóż przykładowe zdania w czasie Present Continuous wykorzystując następujące zwroty: now, at the moment, today, nowadays, this week.
Odpowiedz na poniższe pytania:
content: What do you think your best friend is doing right now?
What are you studying these days?
Are you reading any interesting books these days? Which ones?
What are you doing this year to improve yourself?
Think of your favourite celebrity. What do you think they are doing right now?

exercises.task: Zastanów się, co Twoi znajomi i rodzina prawdopodobnie robią w tej chwili. Utwórz po 2 zdania o każdej osobie - jedno o tym, co być może teraz robi, i drugie o tym, czego prawdopodobnie teraz nie robi.
Zadawanie pytań do tekstu (min. 2 pytania do każdego zdania).
Powiedz czym różni się czas Present Simple od czasu Present Continuous, podaj kilka przykładów.
Ułóż przykładowe zdania w czasie Present Simple wykorzystując następujące zwroty: every month, often, usually, at night, on Sundays.
Ułóż przykładowe zdania w czasie Present Continuous wykorzystując następujące zwroty: now, at the moment, today, nowadays, this week.
Wybierz poprawne uzupełnienie zdania, uzasadnij swój wybór.
content: I (look/am looking) for my glasses now.
Water (boils/is boiling) at 100 degrees.
We (have/are having) guests on Saturday.
You (always leaves/are always leaving) the light on!
The suitcase (belongs/is belonging) to Mr Smith.
Everything (depands/is depanding) on the weather.

content: (Do you use / Are you using) the dictionary at the moment or can I take it?

(Do you understand / Are you understanding) the difference now?

Living on other planets is believed to be possible in less than 50 years.

Time travel was once hoped to be possible.

High tech gadgets are said to cost much more than they are actually worth.
It is said that high tech gadgets cost much more than they are actually worth.

Depending on technological devices is thought to have made us less active.
It is thought that depending on technological devices has made us less active.

Bell was believed to be a great inventor.
It was believed that Bell was a great inventor.

IS Einstein believed to have been the most intelligent person ever?
Is it believed that Einstein was the most intelligent person ever?

exercises.task: Utwórz mieszane zdania warunkowe opisujące poniższe sytuacje.
content: Sam decided to go to a local university, so he's still living at home.

Deb didn't accept the place at Leeds University, so she won't be moving to the UK.
answers: If Sam hadn't decided to go to a local university, he wouldn't still be living at home.
If Lily hadn't spend all her money on clothes, she would be able to go on the school trip.
If Carl didn't have so much revision, he would have gone to the party.
If Maria didn't want to be an opera singer, she wouldn't have attended so many of the opera company's performances.
If Julian's family wasn't/weren't going to travel to the States next wek, he would have signed up for summer classes.
If Sandra wasn't/weren't shy, she would have taken part in the poetry competition last week.
If James hadn't spend his childhood in Spain, he wouldn't do very well in Spanish class.
If Deb had accepted the place at Leeds University, she would be moving to the UK.

You must have read the book because you have so much to say about it now. (unless)
Talking to the teacher might have got you an extension on your due date. (provided that)
answers: You can go to the party on condition that you finish your homework first.
They didn't go to the project meeting, otherwise they would have known about the changes.
They would have arrived on time provided that they had been given the directions to the meeting place.
Unless you had read the book, you wouldn't have so much to say about it now.
You might have got an extension on your due date provided that you had talked to the teacher.

Wybierz poprawne uzupełnienie zdania.
content: All the students (waiting/waited) for the exam results were very nervous.

exercises.task: Uzupełnij zdania właściwą formą czasowników podanych w nawiasach. Użyj reduced relative clauses.
content: Can you see the man ... (wave) at us? That's my roommate.

The woman ... (talk) to my wife is the most creative person I know. She writes books for children.

A black minivan, ... (drive) by a young man, suddenly crashed into a tree.

exercises.task: Przepisz zdania używając reduced relative clauses. Niektóre zdania nie mogą być skrócone.
content: The blonde woman who is standing by the window is my aunt.
All of the classmates, whom Margaret has invited to the party, have refused to come.
The bride was wearing a dress which was ordered from Paris.
The person who won the lottery last week lives in my town.
They are now renovating the bridge which connects the two parts of the city.
Have you had a chance to watch the film which I recommended?
answers: The blonde woman STANDING by the window is my aunt.
The bride was wearing a dress ORDERED from Paris.
They are now renovating the bridge CONNECTING the two parts of the city.

exercises.task: Przepisz zdania używając reduced relative clauses. Dwa z tych zdań nie mogą być skrócone.
content: There is a black car which is parked outside with two police officers who are sitting in it.
Harvard University, which the people of Massachusetts are very proud of, is the oldest in the USA.
The teacher asked the students who were waiting outside her classroom to make less noise.
My brother, who is an excellent cricket player, hopes to join a professional team.
The boy, who had been left alone by his friends, soon began to cry.
The film script, which was written by the author of the novel, is really brilliant.
The football club, which several of my friends are involved in, sounds like a lot of fun.
My best friend Julia, who doesn't have any brothers or sisters, has a large room of her own.
answers: There is a black car PARKED outside with two police officers SITTING in it.
The teacher asked the students WAITING outside her classroom to make less noise.
My brother, BEING an excellent cricket player, hopes to join a professional team.
The boy, LEFT alone by his friends, soon began to cry.
The film script, WRITTEN by the author of the novel, is really brilliant.
My best friend Julia, NOT HAVING any brothers or sisters, has a large room of her own.

exercises.task: Opisz cechy czasowników statycznych i dynamicznych, podaj kilka przykładów. Jeżeli nie wiesz czym są czasowniki statyczne i dynamiczne opisz różnicą między 'stanem', a 'czynnością'.

Podziel podane czasowniki na statyczne i dynamiczne.
content: need
sleep
understand
want
play
agree
believe
dislike
have
read
answers:
Stative verbs: need, understand, want, agree, believe, dislike, have
Dynamic verbs: sleep, play, read

exercises.task: Uzupełnij drugie zdanie tak, aby znaczyło to samo, co pierwsze, używając podanego słowa. Nie zmieniaj podanego słowa.
content:

exercises.task: Przepisz zdania zaczynając od podanych słów.
content:
He is a good journalist and he also writes beautiful poetry.
Not only ... .

We didn't know much about his personal problems.
Little ... .

It's the most foolish story I've ever heard!
Never ... .

As soon as I lay down on the sofa there was a knock on the door.
No sooner ... .

The moment I started the second chapter, it came to my mind who the killer was.
Barely ... .

It was such a difficult problem that no one could solve it.
Such ... .

He seldom sees his family.
Seldom ... .

Until you get to know him better, you won't understand him.
Only after ... .

Immediately after everyone had left the building, the bomb went off.
Hardly ... .

The water was so cold that no one went for a swim.
So ... .
answers: Not only is he a good journalist, but he also writes beautiful poetry.
Little did we know about his personal problems.
Never have I heard a more foolish story.
No sooner had I lain down on the sofa than there was a knock on the door.
Barely had I started the second chapter when it came to my mind who the killer was.
Such a difficult problem was it that no one could solve it.
Seldom does he see his family.
Only after you get to know him better will you understand him.
Hardly had everyone left the building when the bomb went off.
So cold was the water that no one went for a swim.
